僚

Значения

Коллега, чиновник, служащий

Мнемоника

Искажено. Справа — дымовая сигнализация о приближении кочевников в виде линии столбов. Вверху — трава 艹, ниже — огонь 火, солнце 日 и снова огонь. Человек 亻 работник такой линии, служащий.

heisig_story: Person . . . pup tent. Choose some connotation of the key word that will keep it distinct for you from companion (Frame 19), friend (Frame 760), consort (Frame 1287), and comrade (Frame 1765).
koohiiStory1: A colleague implies someone that you share work with, such as in your company or profession, etc. Here your colleague helps you to erect your pup tent during a company outing. Note: Heisig's warning to keep this distinct from other similiar kanji such as companion (#19), friend (#704), consort (#1203) and comrade (#1637). That is why I chose to have the person element pictured as someone (the colleague in this case) helping with the work of building the pup tent.
koohiiStory2: Mr. T began working in a japanese compagny. As he sees that his colleague accept to do some extra work during the week-end and even sleep at the office, he says to them: "I pity da fool who work during week-end! You might as well install a pup tent in the office and forget about your home".

humanum_full_description_en:
From " people " to "尞" sound. The original meaning is good looks. "Said Wen": "Lao, so 皃. From the person, the sound." Such as "Poetry. Chen Feng. "Moonrise": "The moon rises brightly, and the outstanding people are shitty." Mao Chuan: "Liao, good-looking."

Later, " Liao " was often used as an expression of officials. Such as "Mandarin. "Jin Yu": "Let the Drum people go back to their own places, but the officials do not follow." Wei Zhao's note: "Laomen, officials." "Han Shu. "Xue Xuan Zhu Bo Biography": "The minister is willing to do his best, with the Yushi doctor as the rate of 100 officials."

" Liao " also means companions and friends. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The Eleventh Year of Zhaogong": "Quanqiu people have a daughter, and dreamed of using it to cover the temple of the Meng family, and then went to Xizi, and his officials followed it." Du's note: "Anyone who is a friend of a neighbor will run to Xizi." Later Han Books. "The Biography of The Scholars": "(Wei Ying) recites behind closed doors and does not turn to the party. The capital is called it."

" Liao " also specifically refers to people who work together as officials. "Jade articles. "Human Ministry": "Lao, the same bureaucrat as Lao." Such as "Book of Rites. "Qu Lishang": "The Lvxiang Party in the old prefecture called his filial piety, brothers and relatives called his kindness, lay friends called his brother, loyal friends called his benevolence, and friends called his faith." Friends, like-minded people." Another example is "The Latent." "Loyalty": "The Huo family is noble, specializes in the young master, punishes colleagues, abolishes the emperor and establishes the emperor, do not dare to violate."

In ancient times, people were divided into ten classes , and " Liao " was the eighth class. "Zuo Zhuan. The Seventh Year of Zhaogong": "The old king, minister, minister, minister, minister, Shichenzao, Zaochenyu, Yuchenli, ministers, ministers, servants."

humanum_full_description:
從「人」，「尞」聲。本義是美好貌。《說文》：「僚，好皃。从人，尞聲。」如《詩．陳風．月出》：「月出皎兮，佼人僚兮。」毛傳：「僚，好貌。」

　　「僚」後多借為表示官吏。如《國語．晉語》：「令鼓人各復其所，非僚勿從。」韋昭注：「僚，官也。」《漢書．薛宣朱博傳》：「臣願盡力，以御史大夫為百僚率。」

　　「僚」又表示同伴、朋友。如《左傳．昭公十一年》：「泉丘人有女，夢以其帷幕孟氏之廟，遂奔僖子，其僚從之。」杜預注：「鄰女為僚友者隨而奔僖子。」《後漢書．儒林列傳》：「（魏應）閉門誦習，不交僚黨，京師稱之。」

　　「僚」也特指一起做官的人。《玉篇．人部》：「僚，同官曰僚也。」如《禮記．曲禮上》：「故州閭鄉黨稱其孝也，兄弟親戚稱其慈也，僚友稱其弟也，執友稱其仁也，交遊稱其信也。」鄭玄注：「僚友，官同者。執友，志同者。」又如《潛夫論．忠貴》：「霍氏之貴，專相幼主，誅滅同僚，廢帝立帝，莫之敢違。」

　　古代曾把人分為十等，「僚」為第八等。《左傳．昭公七年》：「故王臣公，公臣大夫，大夫臣士，士臣皁，皁臣輿，輿臣隸，隸臣僚，僚臣僕，僕臣臺。」
humanum_short_description: 從「人」，「尞」聲。本義是美好貌。

Meaning Mnemonic
A good leader will use charcoal to mark her colleagues. Sometimes if leaders aren't around all the time, people will get rebellious and act badly toward people who can get them in trouble. So when you mark them with charcoal you know that someone close with your leader is around and you should probably stop being a butt.
Imagine seeing one of the leader's colleagues walking around, watching you. You'd get back to work and stop goofing around, right?
Reading Mnemonic
You have to be good around her colleagues, because if you aren't your row (りょう) boat permit will be taken away. Row boating is the only fun you ever get to have, besides learning kanji. So act as best you can around the leader's colleagues so you don't lose your row boat rights.
Imagine goofing off in your row boat and then seeing one of the colleagues waiting on the shore for you. No! She's gonna take your row boat away!
